Sysmtom: Water leakage from vent holes (While running)
Confirmation: Continuous or intermittent water leakage during running
Check Point: Is the water coming out from airend side vent holes
Procedure: Check physically for the water leakage from airend discharge vent holes
Root Cause: 1)Seal air pressure is low 2)Seal air pressure ball valve kept in close position 3)Seal air pressure MOS filter element choked 4)Defect in the discharge check valve
Solution: 1)Increase the seal air pressure by checking gauge in manifold (Units without Seal air pressure sensor) Increase the seal air pressure by checking the controller display (Units with Seal air pressure sensor) 2)Check and open the ball valve partially and set seal air pressure 3)Replace the seal air pressure MOS filter element or MOS assembly 4)Replace the DCV assembly and maintain the water level

Sysmtom: Water leakage from vent hole after unit shutdown
Confirmation: Water leakage observed after shutdown
Check Point: Check the Discharge check valve condition and its function
Procedure: 1)Switch off the machine in normal stop mode and observe water throw from airend vent holes 2)Dismantle discharge check valve from the system and visually check the condition of spring and plunger
Root Cause: Discharge check valve Spring broken or Improper seating of plunger
Solution: Replace the discharge check valve assembly

Sysmtom: Water leakage from vent hole after unit shutdown
Confirmation: Water leakage observed after shutdown
Check Point: Check the Water stop valve condition and its function
Procedure: Dismantle the Water stop valve from the system and check for dust accumulation and diaphragm seating
Root Cause: 1)Malfunctioning of solenoid coil 2)Diaphragm condition eroded/punctured 3) Accumulation of dust at diaphragm seat
Solution: 1 & 2) Replace the Water stop valve assembly 3) Clean the Water stop valve assembly

Sysmtom: Water leakage from vent hole after unit shutdown
Confirmation: Water leakage observed after shutdown
Check Point: Check the discharge line connection to service line
Procedure: Check whether the compressor discharge line connected as per recommendation
Root Cause: 1) Condesate water entered into the compressor during idle condition through MOS ADV 2) Compressor discharge is not connected as per recommendation
Solution: 1) Ensure the compressor outlet pipe connected by ''inverted U'' with service line 2) Compressor to be isolated from the service line by closing the ball valve

Sysmtom: Water leakage from vent hole after unit shutdown
Confirmation: Water leakage observed after shutdown
Check Point: Check the blow down valve condition and its function while shut down for short time duration
Procedure: Dismantle the blow down valve and check condition of BDV kit
Root Cause: Blow down valve piston stuck/internal parts damaged
Solution: Replace the blow down valve assembly

Confirmation: No water from constant drain valve (Units with CDV drain system) No water from sump ADV drain (Units with sump ADV)
Check Point: Check for the blockage in the constant drain system strainer/orifice
Procedure: Remove the strainer/orifice and check for any dust contaminationor blockage
Root Cause: Foreign particle/Dust/Impurities entry in the water
Solution: 1)Clean/Replace the strainer and orifice assembly 2)Flush the water system and replace new water completely

Confirmation: No water from constant drain valve (Units with CDV drain system) No water from sump ADV drain (Units with sump ADV)
Check Point: Check the sump Auto drain valve (ADV) condition/function
Procedure: Remove and check the function of ADV or blockage
Root Cause: 1) Solenoid valve failed internally 2) Foreign particle/Dust/Impurities entry in the water
Solution: Replace the sump ADV
Key: Auto drain valve ADV Solenoid valve

Confirmation: No water from constant drain valve (Units with CDV drain system) No water from sump ADV drain (Units with sump ADV)
Check Point: Check the water level sensor function
Procedure: Remove and check the water level sensor float condition and its function
Root Cause: Water level sensor failure
Solution: Replace the water level sensor

Sysmtom: High differential pressure water filter alarm
Confirmation: Differential pressure is higher than the set pressure
Check Point: Check if the warning goes OFF when reset button is pressed during running
Procedure: Check the controller display
Root Cause: 1) Controller set value disturbed 2) DP Pressure switch malfunction
Solution: 1) Press the reset button in controller and monitor 2) Check and correct the set value in the switch and set differential pressure of 1.5 bar/ 20Psi 3) Change the pressure switch and set the value as per recommendation

Sysmtom: High differential pressure water filter alarm
Confirmation: Differential pressure is higher than the set pressure
Check Point: Is the differential pressure setting value disturbed
Procedure: Check the Water filter differential pressure set value in DP switch
Root Cause: 1) Controller set value disturbed 2) DP Pressure switch malfunction
Solution: 1)Press the reset button in controller and monitor 2) Check and correct the set value in the switch and set differential pressure of 1.5 bar/ 20Psi 3) Change the pressure switch and set the value as per recommendation

Sysmtom: High differential pressure water filter alarm
Confirmation: Differential pressure is higher than the set pressure
Check Point: Is the water filter element choked
Procedure: Dismantle water filter element from assembly and check for any dust partical accumulation
Root Cause: 1) Water filter element choked/Clogged with dust 2) Maintenance schedule not followed 3) Water quality is poor
Solution: 1) Clean and replace the water filter element 2) Physical inspection for any sediments in the water at site 3) Check the water quality from lab 4) Flush the water system and replace new water completely

Confirmation: Water carry over observed in discharge line/Air receiver/Down stream filter and customer utility side.
Check Point: Check water level tube (Units with Constant drain valve-CDV)
Procedure: Check if the water level is above level tube during running
Root Cause: Low water level in water Separator tank
Solution: Top-up and maintain the water above the water level tube

Confirmation: Water carry over observed in discharge line/Air receiver/Down stream filter and customer utility side.
Check Point: Check water level tube (Units with sump Auto drain valve-ADV)
Procedure: Check if the water level is half of level tube during running
Root Cause: Low water level in water Separator tank
Solution: Top-up and maintain the water half of water level tube

Confirmation: Water carry over observed in discharge line/Air receiver/Down stream filter and customer utility side.
Check Point: Check water carryover at discharge line air receiver downstream filters and customer utility point
Procedure: Phycially check downstream accessories drain points and utility usage points for excess water condensate
Root Cause: 1) High water level in the tank due to Constant drain valve (CDV) line chocked 2) Damaged water separator element 3) After cooler MOS choked
Solution: 1) Check CDV strainer and orifice for any blockage Clean or replace as required 2) Replace the water separator element 3) Clean or replace the MOS auto drain valve 4) Top-up and maintain the water above the water level tube

Confirmation: Water carry over observed in discharge line/Air receiver/Down stream filter and customer utility side.
Check Point: Check for high discharge air water temperature
Procedure: 1)Check for any warning / trip in controller fault history 2)Check the fan motor current and fan motor body temperature 3)Check the air flow (hot air from the cooler out)
Root Cause: 1) High room temperature due to poor ventilation 2) Restriction in the cooler exhaust duct (customer scope) 3) Restriction or hot air back flow due to cooler chock
Solution: 1)If the compressor room temperature above the specified level contact ELGi 2)Verify the exhaust duct design or provision for exhaust fan for improving air flow 3)Clean the cooler with compressed air such that the air passes from inside to out

Confirmation: Water carry over observed in discharge line/Air receiver/Down stream filter and customer utility side.
Check Point: Check RH (Relative Humidity) level at customer site
Procedure: RH level at local site condition
Root Cause: High RH level at site
Solution: Contact ELGI for further details

Confirmation: Water carry over observed in discharge line/Air receiver/Down stream filter and customer utility side.
Check Point: Is the load/unload count high?
Procedure: Check the load count and run hour Load count should be less than 30 per hour
Root Cause: Frequent load and unloading
Solution: 1) Intermittent excess air demand due to application 2)Check the operating pressure band 3)Check the possibility of increasing the receiver size

Confirmation: Water carry over observed in discharge line/Air receiver/Down stream filter and customer utility side.
Check Point: Check for High air demand at customer side
Procedure: Check the discharge pressure at the utility point and it should not go below 5 bar from working pressure
Root Cause: Operating at low working pressure may lead to heavy water carryover
Solution: Check the possibility of running the machine at rated pressure. Customer may need to go for additional machine

Confirmation: Water carry over observed in discharge line/Air receiver/Down stream filter and customer utility side.
Check Point: Check water separator condition and maintenance schedule
Procedure: Remove the water separator element and check dust entry level (visual check)
Root Cause: Differential pressure increased (before and after separation)
Solution: Replace the water separator element

Confirmation: Low seal air pressure in controller display
Check Point: Check the low seal air pressure in controller
Procedure: Check if the ball valve is in partially open condition
Root Cause: Seal air pressure ball valve is not fully open condition
Solution: Open and adjust the ball valve as per specification

Confirmation: Low seal air pressure in controller display
Check Point: Check the air supply to the seal air manifold
Procedure: 1) Check the seal air control line circuit for any leakages 2) Open the seal air moisture filter element and check the condition
Root Cause: 1)Nylon tube bent/damage & leakage in fittings 2)Choked MOS element
Solution: 1)Replace the nylon tube & fittings 2)Clean or replace MOS element

Confirmation: Low seal air pressure in controller display
Check Point: Check the Malfunctioning of Seal air pressure transmitter
Procedure: Cross check the pressure transmitter with source meter
Root Cause: Pressure transmitter failure
Solution: Replace the pressure transmitter

Confirmation: Low seal air pressure in controller display
Check Point: Check if the air demand is high at customer site
Procedure: Check the line pressure with machine rated pressure
Root Cause: The operating pressure may be lesser than the rated pressure of compressor by 1 bar
Solution: Suggest the customer to run the machine at rated pressure (Customer may need to go for additional machine or increase the air receiver capacity)

Confirmation: Low water level in air water sump
Check Point: Check the water level in the air water sump
Procedure: Visually check the water level in sight tube
Root Cause: 1)Water level lower than the recommended operating level 2)Water leakage through airend vent hole during running 3)Water leakage through airend vent hole during shutdown 4)Water carry over through discharge line
Solution: 1)Top up the water as per recommended quantity and monitor 2)Check the seal air pressure (Ref low seal air pressure trouble shooting) 3)Check the discharge check valve condition and replace if required & Check the water stop valve condition and replace if required 4)Refer water carry over on service line trouble shooting
Key: Low water level, Seal air pressure

Confirmation: High water temperature alarm/trip in controller display
Check Point: Check water level tube (Units with Constant drain valve- CDV)
Procedure: Check if the water level is above level tube during running
Root Cause: Low water level in the Water separator tank
Solution: Top-up and maintain the water above the water level tube
Key: Low water level in Water separator tank

Confirmation: High water temperature alarm/trip in controller display
Check Point: Check water level tube (Units with sump Auto drain valve -ADV)
Procedure: Check if the water level is half of level tube during running
Root Cause: Low water level in the water Separator tank
Solution: Top-up and maintain the water half of water level tube

Confirmation: High water temperature alarm/trip in controller display
Check Point: Check cooling fan function and its condition
Procedure: Physical inspection of cooling fan rotation and check control fuse
Root Cause: Fuse blown prematurely/Cooling fan failed
Solution: Replace the fan and fuse

Confirmation: High water temperature alarm/trip in controller display
Check Point: Is the cooling fan rotating in wrong direction
Procedure: Check hot air moves from package inside to outside
Root Cause: Wrong phase connection
Solution: Check electrical circuit and correct connections as per recommendation

Confirmation: High water temperature alarm/trip in controller display
Check Point: Check whether the cooling fan is rotating at full speed
Procedure: Check star delta connections/wire loose connections if any at fan terminal side
Root Cause: 1) Wire loose connection 2)Wrong connection
Solution: 1)Tighten the wire 2)Check electrical circuit and correct connections as per recommendation

Confirmation: High water temperature alarm/trip in controller display
Check Point: Check Air filter condition
Procedure: Dismantle the Air filter element from assembly and check
Root Cause: Air filter element choked with dust
Solution: Clean or replace

Confirmation: High water temperature alarm/trip in controller display
Check Point: Is the compressor Room temperature and Ambient temperature is within limit
Procedure: Check temperature by using scanner
Root Cause: Suction temperature is higher than the recommendation
Solution: Increase the room ventilation

Confirmation: High water temperature alarm/trip in controller display
Check Point: Check water filter element for any dust entry
Procedure: Dismantle water filter assembly and check the element condition
Root Cause: Choked water filter element
Solution: Replace the water filter element

Confirmation: High water temperature alarm/trip in controller display
Check Point: Is the water evacuation is more from airend vent holes to Canopy drain point
Procedure: While running the unit on load / unload check the water level and amount of water moving from vent holes to drain point
Root Cause: Low air seal pressure setting
Solution: Reset the seal air pressure as per recommendation (0.2 bar to 0.5 bar max)

Confirmation: High water temperature alarm/trip in controller display
Check Point: Check seal air pressure MOS element
Procedure: Dismantle MOS assembly and check filter element condition physically
Root Cause: Seal air pressure MOS filter element choked prematurely
Solution: Replace the seal air pressure MOS element/assembly

Confirmation: High water temperature alarm/trip in controller display
Check Point: Check for the water carryover through the service line
Procedure: Check water in discharge line from Receiver tank before air dryer Check service MOS water accumulation for one hour Check any water carry over at utility points
Root Cause: Check RH level and it could be very low (Less than 25%)
Solution: Top up the water to half level in shut down condition

Confirmation: High water temperature alarm/trip in controller display
Check Point: Check water cooler condition
Procedure: Physically check if water cooler fins clogged with dust externally
Root Cause: Dust accumulation in water cooler fins externally
Solution: Clean the water cooler fins with 2 bar (29 Psi) air pressure while the unit is in shut down condition

Confirmation: High water temperature alarm/trip in controller display
Check Point: Check water stop valve function and its condition
Procedure: Dismantle WSV assembly from the unit and check functioning of solenoid valve
Root Cause: Solenoid valve malfunctioning
Solution: Replace the Water stop valve

Confirmation: High water temperature alarm/trip in controller display
Check Point: Check load and unload pattern
Procedure: Check load count and run hour in controller Load count should be less than 30 per hour
Root Cause: Frequent load and unload
Solution: 1) Intermittent excess air demand due to application 2)Check the possibility of increasing the receiver size 3)Check the operating pressure band

Confirmation: High water temperature alarm/trip in controller display
Check Point: Check the temperature reading in controller
Procedure: Check the temperature sensor resistance value by using multimeter (Located at discharge line from airend to tank)
Root Cause: Temperature sensor malfunction
Solution: Replace the temperature sensor

Confirmation: High oil temperature alarm in controller
Check Point: Is the cooling water temperature is high
Procedure: Check the inlet water temperature by using temperature scanner
Root Cause: High inlet water temperature
Solution: Refer the troubleshooting guidelines for high water temperature

Confirmation: High oil temperature alarm in controller
Check Point: Check the oil level airend discharge and suction side
Procedure: It should be half glass visible in level glass after shut down
Root Cause: Low oil level
Solution: Top-up the oil

Confirmation: High oil temperature alarm in controller
Check Point: Check the condition of oil
Procedure: Visual check
Root Cause: Oil thickened and contaminated
Solution: Replace the oil

Confirmation: High oil temperature alarm in controller
Check Point: Check the Temperature sensor malfunction
Procedure: 1)Check the adapter loose connection 2)Check the temperature sensor (check the resistance value against temperature degree)
Root Cause: 1)Wire loose connection in temperature sensor adapter 2)Temperature sensor malfunction
Solution: 1)Tighten the connection with adapter 2)Replace the sensor

Confirmation: Controller trip due to sump pressure not developing (After the start sump pressure should be at least 0.3 bar/4 psi after start delay expires)
Check Point: Check pulse line tubes leakage /BDV line tube leakage
Procedure: Close the discharge service line ball valve and run the unit on unload condition The machine should run continously in unload mode
Root Cause: Leakage in the solenoid valve pulse line and BDV pulse line
Solution: Replace the solenoid valve pulse line and BDV pulse line

Confirmation: Controller trip due to sump pressure not developing (After the start sump pressure should be at least 0.3 bar/4 psi after start delay expires)
Check Point: Check leakage in Tank top plate O ring
Procedure: Remove the tank top plate and check the O ring condition
Root Cause: During unloading sump pressure will not develop
Solution: Replace the O ring and retighten the tank top plate bolts with specific torque

Confirmation: Controller trip due to sump pressure not developing (After the start sump pressure should be at least 0.3 bar/4 psi after start delay expires)
Check Point: Check BDV function and its condition
Procedure: Remove BDV assembly and check internal parts
Root Cause: Continuous air leakage in BDV
Solution: Replace the BDV assembly

Confirmation: Controller trip due to sump pressure not developing (After the start sump pressure should be at least 0.3 bar/4 psi after start delay expires)
Check Point: Check no load sump pressure setting in controller
Procedure: Monitor sump pressure reading while unloading and it should maintain 13 bar to 16 bar (19 psi to 24 psi)
Root Cause: Low sump pressure settings
Solution: Adjust no load sump pressure screw in Intake valve assembly and set it as per specification

Confirmation: Controller trip due to sump pressure not developing (After the start sump pressure should be at least 0.3 bar/4 psi after start delay expires)
Check Point: Check Intake valve actuator position
Procedure: Remove the suction duct and check the intake valve flap position
Root Cause: Failure of intake valve actuator
Solution: Replace the actuator

Confirmation: Controller trip due to sump pressure not developing (After the start sump pressure should be at least 0.3 bar/4 psi after start delay expires)
Check Point: Check Seal air ball valve position and pressure
Procedure: Check seal air pressure in controller
Root Cause: Seal air pressure ball valve in closed condition
Solution: Open and adjust the ball valve as per specification

Confirmation: Controller trip due to sump pressure not developing (After the start sump pressure should be at least 0.3 bar/4 psi after start delay expires)
Check Point: Check MPV condition during unloading It should close 100%
Procedure: Close the discharge service line ball valve and run the unit on unload condition The machine should run continously unload mode If not check MPV kit condition
Root Cause: Failure of MPV O rings and spring
Solution: Replace MPV kit or MPV assembly

Sysmtom: Vibration/chattering in the water line near water filter
Confirmation: Check if any vibration observed in Water filter inlet and injection line
Check Point: Check the water filter element
Procedure: Remove the water filter element from assembly and check the filter condition
Root Cause: Choked water filter element
Solution: Replace the water filter element

Sysmtom: Vibration/chattering in the water line near water filter
Confirmation: Check if any vibration observed in Water filter inlet and injection line
Check Point: Check the Water stop valve (WSV) condition and functioning
Procedure: 1)Wire loose connections in WSV and controller side 2)Provide appropriate power supply to WSV and check the valve working condition
Root Cause: 1)Wire loose connection 2) Water stop valve malfunction
Solution: 1)Correct the loose wire connection 2)Replace the water stop valve

Confirmation: Check if the compressor does not start upon the following conditions 1 MCCB or Isolator turned ON 2 Power supply available 3 Emergency push button released condition 4 Neuron display in RUN mode
Check Point: Check the power supply to the compressor
Procedure: Check the incoming power supply
Root Cause: Incoming power supply disconnected
Solution: Restore the incoming power supply

Confirmation: Check if the compressor does not start upon the following conditions 1 MCCB or Isolator turned ON 2 Power supply available 3 Emergency push button released condition 4 Neuron display in RUN mode
Check Point: Check if the incoming voltage is below limit
Procedure: 1)Check the incoming voltage with multimeter for all three phases 2)Check the isolator capacity and its location from compressor unit 3)Check the cable size
Root Cause: 1)Low voltage lead to tripping of machine while starting 2)Isolator kept in long distance may create low voltage shutting down electricity to the machine may take longer time in case of emergency 3)Wrong selection of cable size
Solution: 1)Check the incoming voltage and ensure sufficient power back up 2)Ensure the isolator is within 5m (16 feet) from the compressor 3)Select the correct cable size from cable selection chart

Confirmation: Check if the compressor does not start upon the following conditions 1 MCCB or Isolator turned ON 2 Power supply available 3 Emergency push button released condition 4 Neuron display in RUN mode
Check Point: Check if the Emergency stop switch in pushed condition
Procedure: Check the emergency stop switch
Root Cause: Emergency stop switch in locked condition
Solution: Rotate counter-clockwise direction and release

Confirmation: Check if the compressor does not start upon the following conditions 1 MCCB or Isolator turned ON 2 Power supply available 3 Emergency push button released condition 4 Neuron display in RUN mode
Check Point: Check if the Emergency stop switch malfunctioning
Procedure: 1)Check the emergency stop switch 2)Check wire loose connection back side of emergency stop switch
Root Cause: 1)Emergency stop switch damaged 2)Wire loose connection
Solution: 1)Clean or replace the emergency switch 2)Tighten the wires at terminals

Confirmation: Check if the compressor does not start upon the following conditions 1 MCCB or Isolator turned ON 2 Power supply available 3 Emergency push button released condition 4 Neuron display in RUN mode
Check Point: Is the isolator fuse blown
Procedure: 1)Check the fuse rating 2)Check the short circuit inside the control panel 3)Check the dedicated isolator provided to the compressor 4)Use megger and check the motor winding/body short (Megger value should be less than 10 mega ohms)
Root Cause: 1)Wrong fuse rating used 2)Short circuit within control panel 3)Dedicated isolator is not provided to the compressor 4)Motor failure due to winding and body short
Solution: 1)Select correct fuse rating from selection chart 2)Correct the short circuit inside the control panel (power and control circuit) 3)Dedicated isolator to be provided to the compressor 4)Rewind/replace the motor if motor failed due to winding and body short

Confirmation: Check if the compressor does not start upon the following conditions 1 MCCB or Isolator turned ON 2 Power supply available 3 Emergency push button released condition 4 Neuron display in RUN mode
Check Point: Check if the incoming phase-to-phase voltage imbalance is more than 5V
Procedure: 1)Check the incoming voltage 2)Check the incoming transformer tapping 3)Check the customer side power factor
Root Cause: 1)Voltage imbalance between phase to phase 2) transformer tapping 3) Customer side power factor is less
Solution: 1)Correct the incoming voltage 2)Adjust the main incoming transformer tapping 3)Correct the power factor to less than unity

Confirmation: Check if the compressor does not start upon the following conditions 1 MCCB or Isolator turned ON 2 Power supply available 3 Emergency push button released condition 4 Neuron display in RUN mode
Check Point: Is the Control MCB malfunctioning
Procedure: Check the MCB input and output voltage
Root Cause: MCB malfunction
Solution: Replace the MCB

Confirmation: Check if the compressor does not start upon the following conditions 1 MCCB or Isolator turned ON 2 Power supply available 3 Emergency push button released condition 4 Neuron display in RUN mode
Check Point: Check if the control fuses inside compressor control panel blown
Procedure: 1)Check for any short circuit or loose connection 2)Check the solenoid valve and control transformer condition 3)Check the control fuse (glass fuse)
Root Cause: 1)Short circuit or loose connection in control circuit 2)Failure of solenoid valve and control transformer 3)Control circuit glass fuse blown
Solution: 1)Correct the short circuit and tighten wires in control circuit 2)Replace the solenoid valve / control transformer if defective 3)Replace the glass fuse

Confirmation: Check if the compressor does not start upon the following conditions 1 MCCB or Isolator turned ON 2 Power supply available 3 Emergency push button released condition 4 Neuron display in RUN mode
Check Point: Check if the control transformer fuse blown
Procedure: Check the control transformer primary and secondary output voltage
Root Cause: Control transformer failure
Solution: Replace the control transformer if defective

Confirmation: Check if the compressor does not start upon the following conditions 1 MCCB or Isolator turned ON 2 Power supply available 3 Emergency push button released condition 4 Neuron display in RUN mode
Check Point: Check the power supply to Neuron controller
Procedure: 1)Check the control fuse (Glass fuse) 2)Check the transformer secondary side control fuse 3)Check the wire loose connection in controller input side 24 V AC
Root Cause: 1)Failure of control fuse(Controller input side) 2)Failure of control fuse (Transformer secondary side) 3)Wire loose connection
Solution: 1)Replace the glass fuse (0.25A for controller, 0.5A for the control circuit) 2)Replace the control transformer fuses 3)Retighten the wire and ensure the 24V AC power supply to Neuron controller

Confirmation: Check if the compressor does not start upon the following conditions 1 MCCB or Isolator turned ON 2 Power supply available 3 Emergency push button released condition 4 Neuron display in RUN mode
Check Point: Check the display in Neuron controller
Procedure: 1)Check the control transformer primary and secondary side control fuse 2)Check the control transformer primary and secondary output voltage 3)Check the loose connections in controller connectors 4)Check the 24 V AC input supply
Root Cause: 1)Control fuse failure (transformer secondary side) 2)Control transformer failure 3)Wire loose connection in connectors 4)Neuron controller failure
Solution: 1)Replace the control fuse 2)Replace the control transformer (50VA) 3)Ensure the tightness of wires in connectors 4)If 24V power supply to Neuron controller is correct then replace with a new Neuron controller

Confirmation: If sump pressure exceeds the set high sump pressure value
Check Point: Is the high sump pressure setting value is above specification
Procedure: Check the high sump pressure set value from controller factory settings
Root Cause: High sump pressure setting value disturbed
Solution: Check and correct the unload pressure and high sump pressure values in Neuron controller as per specification

Confirmation: If sump pressure exceeds the set high sump pressure value
Check Point: Is the unload pressure set value is above specification
Procedure: Check the unload pressure set value from controller operator setting
Root Cause: High sump pressure setting value disturbed
Solution: Check and correct the unload pressure and high sump pressure values in Neuron controller as per specification

Confirmation: If sump pressure exceeds the set high sump pressure value
Check Point: Is the high sump pressure set value is below specification
Procedure: Check the high sump pressure set value from controller factory settings
Root Cause: High sump pressure setting value disturbed
Solution: Check and correct the unload pressure and high sump pressure values in Neuron controller as per specification

Confirmation: If sump pressure exceeds the set high sump pressure value
Check Point: Check the intake valve malfunction
Procedure: 1)Check the function of intake valve opening and closing 2)Check the solenoid valve condition 3)Check the actuator condition opening and closing
Root Cause: 1)Intake valve internal parts damage (Butterfly valve loosen) 2)Solenoid valve plunger struck up 3)Actuator struck up
Solution: 1)Replace the intake valve kit 2)Clean or replace the solenoid valve assembly 3)Replace the actuator kit

Confirmation: If sump pressure exceeds the set high sump pressure value
Check Point: Check the BDV malfunction
Procedure: Check free movement of piston inside the blow down valve
Root Cause: Blow down valve internal parts damage
Solution: Replace the blow down valve assembly
Key: Blow down valve (BDV) internal parts damage

Confirmation: If sump pressure exceeds the set high sump pressure value
Check Point: Check if the compressor started with air outlet ball valve closed
Procedure: Check the outlet ball valve position (closed or Open)
Root Cause: Ball valve in closed condition
Solution: Open the outlet ball valve

Confirmation: If sump pressure exceeds the set high sump pressure value
Check Point: Check the pressure transmitter malfunction
Procedure: Check the pressure transmitter using multimeter
Root Cause: Pressure transmitter failure
Solution: Replace the pressure transmitter

Confirmation: If sump pressure exceeds the set high sump pressure value
Check Point: Check the minimum pressure valve (MPV) malfunction
Procedure: Check MPV pressure by using pressure guage in separator tank
Root Cause: MPV struck and kit damaged
Solution: Replace the MPV kit

Confirmation: Compressor unable to build the specified working pressure
Check Point: Check the pre- filter condition
Procedure: Remove the pre-filter from canopy and check visually
Root Cause: Pre-filter choke
Solution: Clean the pre-filter with compressed air at less than 2.5 bar /36.3 Psi. Refit the filter after cleaning Check and replace as per maintenance schedule

Confirmation: Compressor unable to build the specified working pressure
Check Point: Check air filter element condition
Procedure: Remove the air filter and check visually
Root Cause: Air filter element choke
Solution: Check and replace as per maintenance schedule

Confirmation: Compressor unable to build the specified working pressure
Check Point: Check if the air requirement is more than compressor capacity
Procedure: 1) Check the air leakage 2) Excess pressure drop in pipe line 3) Working pressure is lower than required application pressure
Root Cause: 1&2) Air leakages in the pipeline and utility point 3) Pressure not built up due to excess air demand
Solution: Arrest all pipeline leakages Contact nearest ELGI branch

Confirmation: Compressor unable to build the specified working pressure
Check Point: Check the control air supply to solenoid valve
Procedure: Air leakage in the control line tube
Root Cause: Control line tubes broken
Solution: Replace the control line tubes

Confirmation: Compressor unable to build the specified working pressure
Check Point: Is solenoid valve malfunctioning
Procedure: 1) Check the solenoid valve control supply and valve condition 2) Check the solenoid valve orifice
Root Cause: 1) Control supply got disturbed or solenoid valve failure 2) Blockage in orifice
Solution: 1) Replace the solenoid valve assembly 2) Clean the orifice

Confirmation: Compressor unable to build the specified working pressure
Check Point: Check the electrical supply to solenoid valve
Procedure: Check the electrical supply from controller
Root Cause: R04-Relay failure in controller
Solution: Replace the neuron controller

Confirmation: Compressor unable to build the specified working pressure
Check Point: Check the Intake valve malfunction
Procedure: Check the intake valve condition ( open and close)
Root Cause: Intake valve internal parts damage or struck up
Solution: Check and replace the intake valve kit

Confirmation: Compressor unable to build the specified working pressure
Check Point: Check the Blow down valve (BDV) malfunction
Procedure: Check free movement of piston inside the blow down valve Check the BDV orifice
Root Cause: Blow down valve internal parts damage or struck up Blockage in orifice
Solution: Check and change the BDV assembly Clean the orifice

Confirmation: Compressor unable to build the specified working pressure
Check Point: Check the minimum pressure valve (MPV) malfunction
Procedure: Check the MPV condition
Root Cause: MPV internal parts damage or struck up
Solution: Check and change the MPV kit If required replace the MPV assembly

Confirmation: Compressor unable to build the specified working pressure
Check Point: Check if the Pressure drop across water separator element increased
Procedure: Check the separator element condition
Root Cause: Water separator element choke
Solution: Replace the water separator element Check and replace the water if required based on water condition

Sysmtom: Main Motor and fan motor overload
Confirmation: Check if controller display shows compressor tripped due to main and fan motor overload
Check Point: Check for main motor overload
Procedure: Check if the motor draws high current
Root Cause: Thermal load on motor is more than its capacity
Solution: 1) Room temperature is excessively high, improve ventilation. 2) Contact nearest ELGi office

Sysmtom: Main Motor and fan motor overload
Confirmation: Check if controller display shows compressor tripped due to main and fan motor overload
Check Point: Check for Fan motor overload
Procedure: Visually check the cooler fins for dust accumulation
Root Cause: Cooler choked due to dust entry
Solution: Clean the cooler externally

Sysmtom: Main Motor and fan motor overload
Confirmation: Check if controller display shows compressor tripped due to main and fan motor overload
Check Point: Check the water separator element condition
Procedure: Pressure drop across water separator element increased
Root Cause: Air water separator element choked

Root Cause: 1) Inadequate ventilation inside the compressor room 2) Hot air source towards compressor suction
Solution: Check and ensure that the compressor installation is done as per the guidelines in the operations manual. (for cause #1) 1. The distance of the compressor from wall and other compressors must be maintained as per manual guidelines for ventilation 2. The compressor room roof height must match the recommended levels in the manual. If the height of the roof is not as per the guidelines and if there is no possibility of increasing the roof height, ducting has to be provided as per recommendation. (Contact the nearest ELGi branch office for support) 3. Installation of the exhaust duct fan(s) and ducts must be done as per the site conditions. If not installed earlier, must be completed as per the operations manual guidelines 4. Review the air duct design layout to completely exhaust the hot air from the system 5. Check the possibility of using external exhaust fans or additional windows for adequate ventilation 6. Repair or replace exhaust fans based on their working condition 2) Hot air sources must be routed outside the compressor room ( for cause # 2 )
